subtitle: Made from a Victoria sandwich cake mixture, these cakes are traditionally cooked in scallop shells rather than cake tins.

method.text: Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the flour and knead together. Chill for 30 min.
Place dough on a lightly floured board. Roll out very firmly until thin.
Lightly grease the inside of clean scallop shells. Cut the pastry into large rounds and press these into the shells. Trim the edges, knead this surplus and roll out again to make more rounds.
Place the scallop shells on baking trays. Bake in the oven for 12-15 min or until firm around the edges. Cool in the shells.
Remove carefully from the shells and dust with caster sugar.

title: Aberffraw cake
